snippet: Although retail sales have remained relatively strong, high levels of consumer debt make it unlikely that rapid growth will help power economic expansion.
abstract: Prolonged weakened economic conditions have left American consumers with high levels of debt and little room for a big increase in spending in 2012, a shaky foundation for the most important pillar of the American economy; consumer spending makes up 70 percent of the economy, and until it reignites, economic forecasters say that general growth is likely to be sluggish.

byline.original: By MOTOKO RICH and STEPHANIE CLIFFORD

lead_paragraph: Although retail sales have remained relatively strong, high levels of consumer debt make it unlikely that rapid growth will help power economic expansion.

headline.seo: For 2012, Signs Point to Little Gain in Consumer Spending
headline.main: For 2012, Signs Point to Tepid Consumer Spending
headline.print_headline: Forecasters See Spending Pinch Lingering in ’12
